name: Apple Inc (AAPL)
facts: Apple was founded in 1976 by Jobs, Wozniak, and Wayne.
Apple Park cost over $5 billion to build.
Apple is known for iPhone, iPad, Mac, etc.

scoreboard.name: Track Record
scoreboard.desc: Consistently beats estimates, strong brand efficiency.

scoreboard.name: Profitability
scoreboard.desc: High margins from premium devices & ecosystem.

scoreboard.name: Revenue Quality
scoreboard.desc: Stable hardware plus high-margin services.

scoreboard.name: Analyst Sentiment
scoreboard.desc: Mostly bullish, strong brand loyalty.

scoreboard.name: Company Viability
scoreboard.desc: Ample cash reserves, unstoppable global presence.

scoreboard.name: Alignment
scoreboard.desc: Privacy & environment stance resonates with consumers.

scoreboard.name: Capital Allocation
scoreboard.desc: Aggressive buybacks, consistent dividend growth.

scoreboard.name: Market Position
scoreboard.desc: Top brand in consumer electronics, unstoppable mindshare.

scoreboard.name: Financial Health
scoreboard.desc: Robust balance sheet, large free cash flow.

scoreboard.name: Outlook
scoreboard.desc: AR/VR expansions, wearables pipeline fueling next wave.

bearBullets: Possible supply chain disruptions or macro slowdown.
Competitors gain traction in smartphones & wearables.
Regulatory scrutiny on App Store fees.
Consumer shifts away from premium pricing in downturn.
baseBullets: Steady iPhone & Mac sales, moderate services expansion.
Wearables keep stable yoy growth, no major surprises.
Emerging markets adopt iOS at a measured pace.
Privacy features maintain baseline brand trust.
bullBullets: AR/VR device sparks new growth category.
Services revenue leaps from subscriptions globally.
Emerging markets embrace Apple brand strongly.
Premium margins sustained by brand loyalty.

qa.a: iPhone remains Apple’s top revenue driver, fueling its ecosystem.

qa.q: How does Apple lead in services?
qa.a: They leverage a huge device base for Apple Music, iCloud, and more recurring revenue.
Speculation about AR/VR headsets; Apple often keeps future plans secret until announcement.
They aim for carbon neutrality, use renewable energy in data centers, and incorporate more recycled materials.
Supply chain disruptions, smartphone saturation, and regulatory scrutiny on app store fees.

name: Microsoft Corp (MSFT)
facts: Founded by Bill Gates & Paul Allen in 1975.
Azure is a major revenue driver with strong growth.

scoreboard.name: Track Record
scoreboard.desc: Transformation under Nadella outperforms expectations.

scoreboard.name: Profitability
scoreboard.desc: High margins from software licensing plus Azure returns.

scoreboard.name: Revenue Quality
scoreboard.desc: Enterprise deals plus Office 365 subscriptions.

scoreboard.name: Analyst Sentiment
scoreboard.desc: Wall Street sees stable growth in cloud & enterprise.

scoreboard.name: Company Viability
scoreboard.desc: Dominance in operating systems and productivity suites.

scoreboard.name: Alignment
scoreboard.desc: Open-source contributions, progressive sustainability efforts.

scoreboard.name: Capital Allocation
scoreboard.desc: Steady dividends, large acquisitions (LinkedIn, GitHub).

scoreboard.name: Market Position
scoreboard.desc: Powerhouse in enterprise software, cloud computing.

scoreboard.name: Financial Health
scoreboard.desc: Strong balance sheet with multiple revenue lines.

scoreboard.name: Outlook
scoreboard.desc: Cloud growth, AI integration, potential gaming expansions.

bearBullets: Slow enterprise spending if macro conditions worsen.
Competition from AWS or GCP intensifies.
Regulatory scrutiny on big tech acquisitions.
baseBullets: Office 365 and Azure maintain steady yoy growth.
Incremental expansion in gaming, no huge leaps.
Stable enterprise adoption with moderate competition.
bullBullets: AI supercharges Office & Azure upsell globally.
Major cloud wins from enterprise deals worldwide.
Activision acquisition expands gaming footprint strongly.

qa.a: AWS leads, while Google Cloud also competes; Azure is second by market share.
Historically yes. Currently regulators watch all big tech including MSFT.
AI integration across Office, Azure expansions, gaming acquisitions.
They aim to buy Activision; previously acquired LinkedIn, GitHub, etc.
Competition from AWS, macro downturn impacting enterprise licensing, potential regulatory hurdles.

name: Meta Platforms (META)
facts: Originally Facebook, started in Harvard dorms, 2004.
